title: Drawing, "Elevation of a candlestick; project for an engraving", 1825–35
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper
inscribed: Inscribed in red ink, lower right: No. 41.; below, in black ink: La D.; in black ink, lower left: Fig. 66.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Fluted shaft is topped by a bowl with a flame. From fantastic heads underneath grow two branches. High pedestal shows lion heads with stripes of the hides and two crossed clubs. Feet and a plinth which is flanked by boxes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Elevation of a candlestick; project for an engraving", 1825–35.
1825–35. Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-358.
